summary: High-functioning but emotionally disconnected. Completed intense office work with sustained energy, possibly due to medication (bupropion). Mood was flat with chest ache, especially after work hours. Social detachment noted—triggered mildly by a colleague's comment about lack of laughter. No acute distress, but sense of hollowness and reduced emotional salience.

wins: Sustained work output despite inner detachment
Clarity in self-analysis of current state
losses: No emotional feedback from completed work
Discomfort with social perception of being emotionally distant
ideas: Current state may not be depression or mania—could be neuroadaptive plateau post-med change

goals: Track daily mood-energy-sleep for next 10 days
Set hard upper cap on work hours
Plan psychiatrist check-in within 2 weeks if state persists
triggerEvents: Colleague remark: 'Why don’t you laugh?' triggered emotional self-awareness
